all_searchable_text.description: Special field which searchable text is copied into; similar to the standard `_all` field, but more customisable.  The indexable_content is included in this field.

format.description: This field is less specific than content_store_document_type but is mandatory for every document. May be deprecated in future.

content_purpose_document_supertype.description: Grouping for content performance supertypes. See https://github.com/alphagov/govuk_document_types/blob/master/data/supertypes.yml

content_purpose_supergroup.description: Grouping for content purpose supergroups. See https://github.com/alphagov/govuk_document_types/blob/master/data/supertypes.yml

content_purpose_subgroup.description: Grouping for content purpose subgroups. See https://github.com/alphagov/govuk_document_types/blob/master/data/supertypes.yml

document_type.description: Type of document this data represents.  Implicitly included into all schemas.  Implemented to resolve the deprecation of multiple document types in Elasticsearch 6.x.

email_document_supertype.description: High level group for email subscriptions use to identify publications and announcement. See https://github.com/alphagov/govuk_document_types/blob/master/data/supertypes.yml

search_user_need_document_supertype.description: Grouping for core or government documents. See https://github.com/alphagov/govuk_document_types/blob/master/data/supertypes.yml

user_journey_document_supertype.description: Used to distinguish pages used mainly for navigation (finding) from content pages (thing). See https://github.com/alphagov/govuk_document_types/blob/master/data/supertypes.yml

content_id.description: The content_id of the item. This will not be present for all items, as most application do not send it.

title.description: The page title, as diplayed in internal search results. May differ from the page title tag or top level heading.

description.description: A descrition or summary of the page that can be displayed to users in search results.

link.description: The link to the document.  This is usually the path component of the URL of the document, including a leading slash, but sometimes omits the leading slash, and is sometimes an absolute URL of related content which does not appear on GOV.UK

indexable_content.description: The main chunk of text that is indexed for the page. May not be suitable for users to read. HTML tags are stripped out.  Whitehall sets this field directly, for other documents in the govuk index, see https://github.com/alphagov/search-api/blob/master/lib/govuk_index/presenters/indexable_content_presenter.rb

popularity.description: Popularity indicator used to bias search results. A higher number indicates more pageviews. Updated nightly.

popularity_b.description: Popularity rank used to bias search results. Used at query time to compute a popularity score. A higher number indicates more pageviews. Updated nightly.

organisations.description: The organisations related to this page. This field is copied from the publishing-api. Note that means different things for different formats.

organisation_content_ids.description: As opposed to "organisations", this will include the "content_ids" of each organisation rather than the slug. It will eventually replace "organisations".

primary_publishing_organisation.description: The organisation that published this page. This field is copied from the publishing-api. It is only populated by Whitehall.

specialist_sectors.description: The navigation "topics" that the document is assigned to.  Nothing to do with "policy areas"

topic_content_ids.description: The navigation "topics" that the document is assigned to. Nothing to do with "policy areas". As opposed to "specialist_sectors", this will include the "content_ids" of each topic rather than the slug. It will eventually replace "specialist_sectors".

topical_events.description: The topical events related to this page. These are "slug" identifiers.

policies.description: Policy content related to the page (https://www.gov.uk/government/policies).

policy_areas.description: Policy areas are managed in Whitehall. They're an old grouping of policies, which we're expecting to deprecate soon. Formally known as 'topics'.

mainstream_browse_pages.description: Mainstream browse pages the page can appear in (https://www.gov.uk/browse).

mainstream_browse_page_content_ids.description: As opposed to "mainstream_browse_pages", this will include the "content_ids" of each mainstream browse pagerather than the slug. It will eventually replace "mainstream_browse_pages".

taxons.description: Topics associated with the page. Used for topic pages (e.g. https://www.gov.uk/education).

part_of_taxonomy_tree.description: Any taxon tagged to the document and any of their ancestor taxons

facet_groups.description: Facet groups associated the the documents. Used for tagging documents to finders

facet_values.description: Facet values associated the the documents. Used for modelling facets in finders

updated_at.description: Time of the last indexing. May be significantly newer than `public_timestamp`, as that usually only reflects major updates and not minor ones.

public_timestamp.description: Time of the last update. Used for 1) weighting more recent editions (mainly whitehall content) more highly, 2) the default sort in finders, 3) showing a date in the search results. Should be the same as `public_updated_at` in the publishing-api.

first_published_at.description: The date the content was first published. Should be the same as `first_published_at` in the publishing-api.

end_date.description: End date for topical content. Assume null means in the past for topical event pages.

latest_change_note.description: Note indicating what changed in the last major revision.

id.description: This field will be deprecated in a future version. Do not use.

acronym.description: Acronym associated with the page title. Used for organisation pages.

analytics_identifier.description: A unique identifier used for analytics.

attachments.description: Metadata associated with any attachments linked to this page.

detailed_format.description: A slugified version of the display_type field

display_type.description: Different way of describing content_store_document_type, for some formats. May be deprecated in a future version.

document_collections.description: Document collections this page belongs to (https://docs.publishing.service.gov.uk/document-types/document_collection.html).

image_url.description: The URL of the image associated with an edition

release_timestamp.description: When statistics will be released, for statistics announcement pages.

display_date.description: The display text for the proposed release date for a statistics announcement.  This may be approximate.

metadata.description: The "metadata" field is intended for the storage of additional non-searchable document data. This allows additional information to be stored and displayed in search results without having to make changes to the schema.

operational_field.description: The place a fatality notice applies to.

child_organisations.description: A list of organisations that are children of the organisation.

parent_organisations.description: A list of organisations that are parents of the organisation.

superseded_organisations.description: A list of organisations that are superseded by the organisation.

superseding_organisations.description: A list of organisations that supersede the organisation.

organisation_brand.description: The branding (controls the colour) of the organisation logo

organisation_crest.description: The class name of the crest to display when rendering the organisation logo

organisation_state.description: Status of an organisation page on GOV.UK: {live, joining, exempt, transitioning, closed, devolved}

organisation_closed_state.description: Status of a closed organisation page on GOV.UK: {no_longer_exists, replaced, split, merged, changed_name, left_gov, devolved}

organisation_type.description: The organisation type identifier, like 'ministerial_department' or 'public_corporation'. Only applies to organisations. Expected value is the `organisation_type_key` from Whitehall, enumerated in https://github.com/alphagov/whitehall/blob/master/app/models/organisation_type.rb.

people.description: Links to people associated with this page (https://www.gov.uk/government/people).

policy_groups.description: Links to policy groups (working groups) associated with this page (https://www.gov.uk/government/groups).

relevant_to_local_government.description: No longer used. Will be removed in a future version.

search_format_types.description: Filters used by publications/announcement pages (https://www.gov.uk/government/publications/). May be deprecated in a future version.

slug.description: The trailing part of the link. Two slugs belonging to the same format must be unique.

statistics_announcement_state.description: State of a statistical announcement page; one of {cancelled, confirmed, provisional}

world_locations.description: World location associated with this page (https://www.gov.uk/world).

has_official_document.description: Used for official document status filter on publication page (publication formats only).

has_command_paper.description: Used for official document status filter on publication page (publication formats only).

has_act_paper.description: Used for official document status filter on publication page (publication formats only).

aircraft_category.description: Used for official document status filter on publication page (publication formats only).

report_type.description: Report type for MAIB, RAIB, AAIB reports. Possible values vary by format.

date_of_occurrence.description: Date of the event described in the document. Only applies to MAIB, RAIB, AAIB reports.

registration.description: Metadata associated with an AAIB report (https://www.gov.uk/aaib-reports/)

aircraft_type.description: Metadata associated with an AAIB report (https://www.gov.uk/aaib-reports/)

location.description: Location metadata. Not comparable between different formats.

case_type.description: Similar to report_type: applies to CMA cases.

case_state.description: Whether a case is open or closed. Applies to CMA cases.

country.description: Country associated with the page. Does not link to a page on GOV.UK. See also 'world_locations'.

market_sector.description: Market sector a CMA case relates to.

opened_date.description: Open date of a CMA case

closed_date.description: Close date of a CMA case

contact_groups.description: Contact groups a 'contact' page belongs to.

land_use.description: Countryside stewardship grant land use type (https://www.gov.uk/countryside-stewardship-grants).

tiers_or_standalone_items.description: Countryside stewardship grant land tiers or standalone items (https://www.gov.uk/countryside-stewardship-grants).

logo_formatted_title.description: The title (with line breaks) to be displayed alongside the organisation logo

logo_url.description: The url of the custom logo - applies to organisations with a custom logo

manual.description: Base path of the manual this document belongs to. Eg `/service-manual` or `/hmrc-internal-manuals/air-passenger-duty`

is_political.description: If the content is considered political in nature, reflecting views of the government it was published under

is_historic.description: If the content is political and published by a previous government, it is considered historic and not reflecting of the current government

is_withdrawn.description: If the content has been published but then withdrawn

government_name.description: The name of the Government that first published this document, eg, '1970 to 1974 Conservative government'

exact_query.description: Field used in the best-bet implementation to perform an exact match between a user's query and a stored best-bet

stemmed_query.description: Field used in the best-bet implementation to perform a stemmed match between a user's query and a stored best-bet

stemmed_query_as_term.description: Field used in the best-bet implementation to hold the raw form of a stemmed query

details.description: Field used in the best-bet implementation to store the modifications to be made to the query when a best-bet is matched

path_components.description: Field used in the page-traffic index to hold the full paths of each component of a url.  eg: a document with a path of '/foo/bar/baz' would have the values '/foo', '/foo/bar' and '/foo/bar/baz' in this field.  This allows all the pages under a given URL component to be identified.

rank_14.description: Field used in the page-traffic index to hold the rank of this page in the list of pages on the website when ordered by traffic.  This is a fairly stable value used in ranking calculations.

spelling_text.description: Generated field, populated with the same content as sent to the _all field, but tokenised into words, lowercased and shingled, not stemmed, etc

important_to_policy.description: A flag set by editors to mark a document as being important to policy

dfid_authors.description: A set of author names, which aren't selected from a predefined list and don't repeat

dfid_review_status.description: Whether or not this item is peer reviewed (a code)

dfid_theme.description: The broad theme (or themes) to which the output applies

dfid_document_type.description: The document type of the output (e.g. Book Chapter, Conference Paper)

assessment_date.description: The date when the assessment was held.

service_provider.description: The organisation providing the service under assessment.

stage.description: The current stage of the service under assessment.

content_store_document_type.description: The document type as stored in the Content Store

business_sizes.description: The sizes of business served by a business finance support scheme

business_stages.description: The stages of business served by a business finance support scheme

industries.description: The industries served by a business finance support scheme

regions.description: The regions served by a business finance support scheme

types_of_support.description: The types of support provided by a business finance support scheme

licence_identifier.description: The licence ID associated with a content item of type licence

sifting_status.description: The open/close/etc state of a statutory instrument

subject.description: The associated top level taxon for statutory instruments

laid_date.description: The date on which a statutory instrument was laid before parliament

sift_end_date.description: The date on which sifting of a statutory instrument ends

withdrawn_date.description: The date on which a statutory instrument was withdrawn

certificate_status.description: The active/on-hold state of the certificate

commodity_type.description: The type of the commodity being exported

appear_in_find_eu_exit_guidance_business.description: Flag to control if this document should appear in the finder, as it is not restricted by document type.

employ_eu_citizens.description: Whether or not the EU citizens are employed

business_activity.description: Whether or not the going concern does business in the EU and their type of business (e.g. buying, selling, transporting)

regulations_and_standards.description: Regulations that apply to the business

personal_data.description: The type of personal data processing the organisation handles

intellectual_property.description: The type of intellectual property a business holds

eu_uk_government_funding.description: The EU scheme from which the business receives its funding

public_sector_procurement.description: The public sector body that procures goods or services
